Career Pathways

Digital & Technology

The digital sector in Yorkshire is rapidly growing, with opportunities spanning software development, cybersecurity, data analysis, and digital transformation.

Technical Skills

  • Programming
  • Web Development
  • Database Management
  • Cloud Computing

Problem Solving

  • Analytical Thinking
  • Debugging
  • System Design
  • Logic

Soft Skills

  • Communication
  • Team Collaboration
  • Project Management
  • Adaptability
Education Options

Training Pathways

University Route

(3-4 years)

Traditional degree pathway with work placement opportunities. Gain comprehensive theoretical knowledge alongside practical experience through industry placements.

Apprenticeship

(18-24 months)

Learn while you earn with hands-on industry experience. Split your time between workplace training and structured learning.

Bootcamp

(12-16 weeks)

Intensive practical training perfect for career changers. Focus on job-ready skills through project-based learning.

Your Journey

Career Progression

1

Entry Level

£24,000 - £30,000

0-2 years

Common Roles

Junior DeveloperIT SupportJunior Data Analyst

Key Skills

Programming BasicsProblem SolvingCommunication
2

Mid Level

£35,000 - £50,000

2-5 years

Common Roles

Software DeveloperSystems AdministratorData Scientist

Key Skills

Advanced ProgrammingProject ManagementTechnical Leadership
3

Senior Level

£50,000 - £80,000

5+ years

Common Roles

Senior DeveloperTechnical ArchitectIT Manager

Key Skills

System ArchitectureTeam LeadershipStrategic Planning
